alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 8:29PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southwestern Wallace and northwestern Greeley Counties in west central Kansas through 915 PM MDT... At 829 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Towner, or 19 miles southeast of Cheyenne Wells, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weskan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
